# Game Theory:<br/>Nationalism and<br/>Prisoner's Dilemma {#game-theory .center}

## Free Riding: Five Countries {#free-riding data-transition="fade-out"}

:::::: {.columns .mtop-3}
::: {.column .eighty}
```{r prisoners_dilemma}
df <- tibble(
  abatement = seq(1,10),
  marginal_cost = abatement * 3,
  marginal_benefit = 25,
  cumulative = cumsum(marginal_cost),
  cumu_benefit = cumsum(marginal_benefit)
)

optimum_abatement = 8
optimum_cost = 108
n_countries = 5
opt_world_abatement = optimum_abatement * n_countries
opt_world_cost = optimum_cost * n_countries
marg_world_benefit = 25
marg_country_benefit = marg_world_benefit / n_countries
opt_world_benefit = opt_world_abatement * marg_world_benefit
opt_country_benefit = opt_world_benefit / n_countries
opt_net_country_benefit = opt_country_benefit - optimum_cost
opt_net_world_benefit = opt_net_country_benefit * n_countries

kable(df, col.names = c("Tons<br/>Abated", 
                        "Marginal<br/>Cost<br/>(One<br/>Country)", 
                        "Marginal<br/>Benefit<br/>(All<br/>Countries)", 
                        "Cumu-<br/>lative<br/>Cost<br/>(One<br/>Country)",
                        "Cumu-<br/>lative<br/>Benefit<br/>(All<br/>Countries)"))
              
```
:::
::: {.column .eighty .textleft .ptop-1}
* Five Countries
  * Benefits for each ton of abatement by anyone:
    * Each country: \$`r marg_country_benefit`
    * World: \$`r marg_world_benefit` (\$`r marg_country_benefit` 
      for each of `r n_countries` countries)
  * {+} Optimum:
    * What is the optimum abatement?
    * {+} Optimum abatement is `r optimum_abatement` tons from each country
      * $`r n_countries` \times `r optimum_abatement`~\text{tons} = `r opt_world_abatement`~\text{tons}$ total
:::
::::::

## Free Riding: Five Countries {#free-riding-2 data-transition="fade"}

:::::: {.columns .mtop-3}
::: {.column .eighty}
```{r ref.label="prisoners_dilemma"}
```
:::
::: {.column .eighty .textleft .ptop-1}
* If everyone abates `r optimum_abatement` tons:
  * {+} Each country pays $`r optimum_cost`
  * {+} Total abatement = $`r n_countries` \times `r optimum_abatement`~\text{tons} = `r opt_world_abatement`~\text{tons}$
  * {+} Each country benefits $`r opt_world_abatement` \times \$`r marg_country_benefit` = \$`r opt_country_benefit`$
  * {+} Net benefit for each country: \$`r opt_net_country_benefit`
  * {+} Net benefit for World: $\$`r opt_net_country_benefit` \times `r n_countries` = \$`r opt_net_world_benefit`$
:::
::::::

## Free Riding: Five Countries {#free-riding-3 data-transition="fade"}

:::::: {.columns .mtop-3}
::: {.column .eighty}
```{r ref.label="prisoners_dilemma"}
```
:::
::: {.column .eighty .textleft .ptop-1}
* If everyone abates `r optimum_abatement` tons:
  * Total abatement: `r opt_world_abatement` tons
  * Each pays \$`r optimum_cost`, benefits \$`r opt_country_benefit`
  * Net benefits: 
    * \$`r opt_net_country_benefit` for each country, 
    * \$`r opt_net_world_benefit` for the world
* {+} Four abate `r optimum_abatement` tons, one abates 1 ton
  * {+} Four pay \$`r optimum_cost`, one pays \$3
  * {+} Total abatement = 33 tons
  * {+} Each country benefits $33 \times \$5 = \$`r 33 * 5`$
  * {+} Net benefits: 
    * 4 countries get \$57 (\$`r opt_net_country_benefit - 57` worse off),
    * One gets \$162 (\$`r 162 - opt_net_country_benefit` better off),
    * {+} World: \$390 (\$`r opt_net_world_benefit - 390` worse off).
:::
::::::

## Nash Equilibrium {#nash-eq}

* {+} If everyone does the same thing:
  * Everyone is best off cutting 8 tons
* {+} If everyone else cuts 8 tons:
  * I am best off cutting 1 ton
* {+} No matter what everyone else does:
  * I am better off cutting 1 ton
* {+} If everyone does what is best for themself:
  * Everyone is worse off than if everyone cooperates
* {+} "Prisoner's dilemma"

# Krugman on Nordhaus {#krugman-sec .center}

## Historical Perspective {#historical-perspective .ninety}

* {+} **Early Nordhaus:**
  * {+} Debunker
  * {+} Emphasized high discount rates
  * {+} Estimated relatively small damages from warming
  * {+} Conclusion: No rush to decarbonize, do it slowly and cheaply
* {+} **Later Nordhaus:**
  * {+} Every assessment increases estimates of damage: 
    * More urgency: spend more, decarbonize faster
  * {+} Discount rates don't matter as much as he used to think
  * {+} Unmanageable Systems
    * Conclusion: Keep warming from going much above 2&deg;C

## Krugman's Criticisms {#criticisms}

* Nordhaus emphasizes carbon pricing
  * Economically this is about balancing multiple factors
  * But one factor is dominant: coal-fired electricity
  * When one factor dominates, stronger case for command-and-control regulation
* {+} Policy target:
  * Criticizes (debunks) 2&deg;C target: "Not very scientific"
  * But concludes optimum target is around 2.3&deg;C
* {+} Big picture:
  * Will _The Climate Casino_ change anyone's mind?

## Discuss

* We have read four different perspectives on climate policy:
  * Nordhaus _Climate Casino_ (pricing carbon, "buying insurance")
  * Pielke _Climate Fix_ ("oblique strategy")
  * Victor _Global Warming Gridlock_ (clubs of nations)
  * Gilligan & Vandenbergh _Beyond Politics_ (private governance)
* Discuss what you think are the strenths and weaknesses of each approach
* What would you advocate for climate policy?
